author: cnbc.com
title: Mike Supple Joins MedeAnalytics as Member of its Board of Directors
text:
RICHARDSON, Texas, March 22, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- MedeAnalytics , a pioneer in healthcare analytics, today announced the appointment of Mike Supple as the newest member of its Board of Directors. Supple brings more than 25 years of executive leadership experience and currently serves as executive vice president at top healthcare executive consulting and search firm B.E. Smith, a member of AMN Healthcare.
"We are pleased to welcome Mike to our Board of Directors," said Paul Kaiser, chief executive officer of MedeAnalytics. "Mike is a truly innovative thinker and well-respected leader in the healthcare industry. His expertise will be invaluable as MedeAnalytics heads into its next growth phase. Our leadership team shares his passion and commitment to empowering healthcare organizations with the insights and resources needed to improve care while reducing costs. We look forward to his contributions to the Board and our larger network."
As B.E. Smith executive vice president, Supple is an active advisor to many large health systems in addition to his leadership of the organization's end-to-end business operations. His career has involved supporting major healthcare organizations and Fortune 50 companies.
"MedeAnalytics has made great strides in improving healthcare through data analytics and I am eager and honored to join the Board," said Supple. "I look forward to collaborating with fellow Board members and MedeAnalytics executive leaders to help guide the organization through continued success and growth."
Prior to his current position, Supple held various senior management positions at Cerner Corporation, helping to build and grow an account portfolio of $50 million to over $400 million in revenue during his eight-year tenure. Before joining Cerner, Supple spent 12 years in leadership at Digital/Compaq, where he cultivated partnerships with healthcare providers across the United States.
Supple holds a Master of Business Administration degree from Washington University in St. Louis and a Bachelor of Business Administration with an emphasis in Marketing and Finance from the University of Iowa. He is a recognized industry leader, an advocate for his clients and an expert on healthcare trends, challenges and opportunities.
About MedeAnalytics ®
MedeAnalytics provides evidence-based insights to solve a real problem that plagues healthcare – how to use the immense amount of patient data collected along the care continuum to deliver cost-effective care and promote a healthier population. Its analytics platform delivers intelligence that helps healthcare organizations detect their greatest areas of risk and identify opportunities to improve their financial health. It empowers providers and payers to collaborate and use data to strengthen their operations and improve the quality of care. MedeAnalytics' cloud-based tools have been used to uncover business insights for over 1,500 healthcare organizations across the United States and United Kingdom. The company has also been named one of Modern Healthcare's top 100 Best Places to Work in Healthcare for 2014, 2015 and 2016. For more information, visit www.medeanalytics.com .
